text: An overcast sky. A dark truck cruises down the two-lane blacktop, passing hideous trailers. The pick-up slows as it nears a dirt road.

Broken radio. A cigarette pack rests in the cupholder. A camcorder sits in the passengerвЂ™s seat. CHRIS WHITEHEAD, 28, drugged-out neвЂ™er-do-well, handles wheel, feeling every bump the old road has to offer. His frenetic eyes stare out the windshield, searching for certain spot.
(whisper ) Chris.
Woods everywhere. Not a house in sight. Rampant weeds conquer the secluded yard. Empty bottles an cans scatter across the lawn. The truck pulls in. Chris steps out.
Chris. Chris stumbles around, panicking.

Where are you? He stops, stunned. Chris sees LOUISE LEWTON, 16, innocent country girl, standing a few feet away. A torn dress covers her smooth skin. She glares at Chris, holding his gaze. ChrisвЂ™s eyes go blank. Hypnotized. He stares at Louise he needs her approval.

IвЂ™m watching. Louise watches Chris undress. He pulls down his boxers. H naked, vulnerable. Leaning over, Chris grabs the camcorder. He places it on truckвЂ™s hood. The camcorderвЂ™s red record light glows.
ItвЂ™s your turn, Chris. Chris grabs a longneck off the ground. He SLAMS it agains the pick-up, SMASHING it into a million pieces. His blood hand grips a large shard.
Do it, Chris. Facing Louise, he gets down on his knees.

Do it for me. Chris opens his mouth. Raises the sharp piece of glass ov it. He slowly lowers the shard, the glass disappearing down h throat, going deeper and deeper. Louise watches him with merciless eyes. Blood trickles down ChrisвЂ™s mouth as he stares at her. gags, WHEEZING up blood. One final shove. Like a spear, the glass protrudes out th back of ChrisвЂ™s neck. He collapses to the ground. Convulses. Blood flows around the lodged shard, running through the tall grass. All the while, the unrelenting camera records the grisly scene. Chris goes still, lifeless. His body lies in the yard, all alone. Louise is gone.
Afternoon. The sun struggles to break through. A Honda zips down the desolate road.

Messy, cramped. An early-2000s pop SONG plays on the radi VIVIEN TRACY, 33, elegant yet headstrong, sits behind the wheel. Her husband JAMIE, 28, scrawny introvert, slouches over in the passengerвЂ™s seat. VivienвЂ™s cell phone lies in the cupholder. A flamboyant flyer hangs out of her purse: Welcome back, Class of 2006 Gazing out the window, Vivien admires all of the local farmland.
ItвЂ™s gorgeous. Jamie glances at the fields, unimpressed.
Looks the same. Vivien grabs her phone and checks the GPS. Ten miles from their destination.
You know you donвЂ™t have to do this. Vivien looks at him, a little confused.
What do you mean? Jamie shifts in his seat.
Coming here. ItвЂ™s not your reunion. She rests her hand on his leg.
Babe, I want to.
Naw, IвЂ™m serious. LetвЂ™s just go to Florida or something. Fuck all this.
Jamie.
What? ItвЂ™s a better idea, donвЂ™t you think?
What would we tell everybody? Sarah, Casey.
Invite them to go with us! ItвЂ™1ll be like Daytona.
No, itвЂ™s too late.
Seriously, youвЂ™d pick Whigham over Daytona?
Not when you put it like that.
IвЂ™m telling you, youвЂ™re gonna be bored as fuck. This townвЂ™s nothing.
ItвЂ™s where you grew up!
Sadly. Like an excited tourist, Vivien points toward a herd of cattle grazing in a wide field.
Look at it! ItвЂ™s so pastoral.
"Pastoral?"
Peaceful. Grinning, Jamie points her toward a dilapidated shack.
Yeah, thatвЂ™s some "pastoral" shit right there. Vivien gives him a soft punch.
Jerk.
Look, itвЂ™s a waste, IвЂ™m telling you.
No, itвЂ™s not.
Trust me.
YouвЂ™re not even giving it a chance.
Why would I?
Well. I think itвЂ™1l be good for us. Jamie groans as she squeezes his arm.
ItвЂ™s a change of pace, something different.
Yeah. A change of pace, alright.
Besides, IвЂ™m a little curious.
About what?
Maybe I want to know more about my mysterious husband.
IвЂ™m right here.
Like your past past. Like what you were like in high school.
God, whoвЂ™d wanna know that?
I do!
That shit should stay buried.
Oh my God. Whatever.
I donвЂ™t wanna remember. Not like all these other losers thatвЂ™1l be roaming the place.
Well, let me find out.
ThereвЂ™s nothing to know.
The only time I ever heard anything was from your mom.
Stick with that version. Vivien wraps her arm around Jamie.
This is going to be fun. ItвЂ™1ll be like solving a mystery.
Yikes.
The enigmatic Jamie Tracy.
"Enigmatic?"
Strange, elusive. Like a riddle.
You make me sound like a magician.
And you sound like youвЂ™ve got something to hide. A flamboyant DJ chats over a TRACKвЂ™s final seconds.
That oneвЂ™s going out to Marion whoвЂ™s in town for the reunion this weekend.
Like another wife.
Damn, you got me. Vivien laughs.
Keep those skeletons in the closet.
HereвЂ™s another hot one for you, class of two-thousand-and-six. Straight out of the MySpace vaults. Another annoying mid-aughts SONG comes on. Vivien smiles, recognizing the catchy tune instantly.
Oh my God! She turns up the radio. Jamie groans.
Back from the dead.
I love it! Jamie watches her groove to the beat, amused.
This is gonna be a long trip.
Whatever. You know you like it.
Lies. Belting the awful lyrics, Vivien grabs JamieвЂ™s hand, serenading him. Jamie fakes a cringe.
Aw, boy. Vivien smiles and hits his shoulder.
Come on, sing it with me.
Naw, I canвЂ™t compete with that.

VivienвЂ™s Honda cruises past a thick forest. Like a morbid statue, Louise stands near a cluster of dyi trees, watching the car drive out of sight. EXT. CASEYвЂ™S HOUSE - FRONT YARD - DAY Trimmed hedges surround a large country home. Decorated walkway. Brick mailbox. Picture perfect. A squad car and flawless sports car sit out front. VivienвЂ™s Honda parks further away. Vivien opens the door and steps out. SARAH THORNTON, 28, beleaguered former beauty queen, rush up.
Hey, you made it! She greets Vivien with a hug.
I know. ItвЂ™s been forever.

Too long, girl. Holding VivienвЂ™s purse, Jamie exits the Honda. CASEY, 28, washed-up alpha dog, SarahвЂ™s husband, walks toward him, a mischievous smirk on his face. He wears his police uniform with pride.
Nice purse, "Janie."
Really, Casey? Jamie plays it off. He hands the purse back to Vivien.
Thanks, man. Vivien gives him the keys.
ItвЂ™s about time you came outta the closet. Jamie and Casey exchange a bromantic handshake. Sarah looks over at Vivien.
HowвЂ™d you train him to do that?
A lot of practice.
Looks like you made him your little bitch to me.
Come on, now.
Just saying.
All that psychology.
ThatвЂ™s her forte, right? Vivien notices the impressive house.
Wow. Jamie leads Casey to the trunk. Casey flashes Vivien a sm grin.  10.
You like it?
ItвЂ™s nice.
(to Casey) DonвЂ™t take too much credit for it. She leans in toward Vivien.
His dad forked over the down payment. Jamie opens the trunk.

Hey, it wasnвЂ™t that much! Sarah rolls her eyes, prompting a chuckle from Vivien. INT. CASEYвЂ™S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT A flat screen plays a muted slasher MOVIE. An auxiliary cord connects CaseyвЂ™s phone to a gigantic speaker, blasting mid-2000s rock TUNES. Longnecks and empty cans populate the long coffee table. small trash bin sits next to the table. Vivien and Jamie occupy a couch, Sarah on the other.
IвЂ™ve been planning it for awhile.
ThatвЂ™s awesome!
Yeah, weвЂ™1l see.
You should totally do it. ThatвЂ™d be great.
I know. ItвЂ™s been my dream.  11.
Hey, IвЂ™m banking on it too. Sarah laughs as Vivien hits him. Wearing a
IвЂ™ve gotten used to the luxuries of being a doctorвЂ™s husband.
Your sugar mama.
Gross.
Sugar mama? sloppy bathrobe, Casey enters.
ItвЂ™s about time.
(to Jamie) I always knew youвЂ™d make a good housewife. Vivien rubs JamieвЂ™s leg.
The cub to my cougar. Casey plops down next to Sarah.
Thanks, "sugar mama."
Aww.
Surprise, surprise. Casey tosses a Ziploc bag to the table. Marijuana city. Jamie grabs it, excited.
Holy shit!  12.
Where the HellвЂ™d you get that?
Wow.
Perks of the job. Relax. Sarah punches his chest.
Ow! Damn, Sarah.
Boy, are you crazy? You canвЂ™t be doing shit like that! Casey pulls out the coffee tableвЂ™s drawer. An exquisite glass pipe lurks inside.
So what? Who cares?
I do!
Yeah, not the smartest idea.
YвЂ™all, no oneвЂ™s gonna miss it, alright. This shit was gathering dust.
Good point. Casey packs the bowl.
You think IвЂ™d be dumb enough to get caught?
Uh, yeah.
I mean thereвЂ™s nothing wrong with it.  13.
There. You see.
Just as long as you share. Casey offers his fist.
My man! Jamie completes the fistbump.
Idiots.
Baby, I was super careful, I promise. He puts the pipe to his lips.
That donвЂ™t mean shit.
No oneвЂ™s wanting it, no oneвЂ™s gonna miss it. Lifting a lighter, he ignites the cannabis.
So weвЂ™re gonna enjoy it.
Ugh. He inhales. Coughs like a first-timer.
Reunion pot. Nice. Casey holds it toward Sarah. With reluctance, she obliges
Exactly. Janie gets it.
ItвЂ™s Jamie, man. Sarah hits it. A violent cough.  14.
So is that like a high school thing?
What?
"Janie?" Like a bully, Casey chuckles with glee.
Oh shit.
No, itвЂ™s just some stupid shit he came up with.
Fits like a glove.
Hey, fuck you, man.
Yo, you brought it on yourself, bro. Sarah hands the pipe to Vivien. Trying to be polite, Vivien declines.
What? Really?
That doesnвЂ™t mean it has to follow me for fifteen years.
Yeah, like youвЂ™ve really earned your man card. Marrying a doctor.
(to Sarah) I really shouldnвЂ™t.
(muttering) Shithead.  15.
(to Vivien) Come on, do it! He leans in, goading her on.
This is the real shit. Deadass serious.
She doesnвЂ™t have to. CaseyвЂ™s pressuring makes Vivien reconsider. She eyes th pipe.
"EverybodyвЂ™s doing it."
(annoyed) Casey. Jamie looks at Vivien.
If you donвЂ™t want to, itвЂ™s--
Let her make up her own mind, "Jamie." Goddamn. Vivien chuckles. Jamie glares at Casey. Casey snatches the pipe from Sarah.
Here. He leans in toward Vivien, a little flirtation in the gesture.
SheвЂ™s a big girl. Vivien flashes him a sly smile. She grabs it.
Yeah, there you go!  16.
Get it, girl. Casey performs a slow clap.
Dr. TracyвЂ™s in the house.
Dr. Dahlgren actually. Casey nods, a little awkward.
Okay. His emotions eviscerated, Jamie looks away. Sarah pats Vivien on the back. With excitement, she watch Vivien take a hit.
whoo! Smiling, Vivien leans forward and coughs in JamieвЂ™s lap
Oh shit! Jamie grins and rubs the back of VivienвЂ™s head.
Oh God. She hands it to Jamie.
Courtesy of Whigham Public Safety.
Of course. Jamie inhales. He hacks. Hands the pipe back to Casey.
Janie the lightweight over here.
I think thatвЂ™d make anyone a lightweight.  17.
True. Jamie leans back, still struggling.
Jesus, Jamie. DonвЂ™t die on me, buddy.
YouвЂ™re the cop.
I ainвЂ™t performing CPR on no dude. Casey takes a hit. Vivien grabs a longneck off the table.
Well, whereвЂ™s this new school at? The gymnasium. Jamie glances at the television. The slasher flick features a nighttime sequence in a rura forest.
ItвЂ™s a few miles out past the old one. Cal Cloud Road.
Kinda looks like a prison.
Yeah, itвЂ™s huge. On screen, Louise stands in a clearing, her eyes staring right at Jamie.
(to himself) Fuck.
ThatвЂ™s all high school is. Just one big cell for our dreams and aspirations.
Geez, you make it sound like a horror movie.  18. Louise steps toward the screen, holding JamieвЂ™s horrifi gaze.

I donвЂ™t know. I work with all these kids and it kills them, it really does. The education systemвЂ™s so weak and when you combine that with bullying, peer pressure. It just makes it tough. Louise nears closer and closer.
Maybe for some kids. He nods at the uneasy Jamie.
Like this guy. Sarah hits Casey.
Chill out with that.

Your only friend. On screen, Louise holds her hands out, reaching for Jamie
(whisper ) Jamie. The trembling Jamie leaps off the couch.
No!
Jamie. Vivien tries to grab him. Jamie backs away, avoiding her touch.
What is it? WhatвЂ™s wrong? She stands up.  19.
Yo, you alright? They watch Jamie stagger back. Breathing heavy, he looks back at the television. No Louise. Just another MASKED PSYCHOPATH trapped in a low-budget movie.
No, she was just there. Vivien snags JamieвЂ™s arm, startling him.
Oh fuck!
Jamie, itвЂ™s just me. He pulls back.
DonвЂ™t fucking touch me! Casey stands up.
Yo, chill out, bro. Jamie stares at them, desperate.
It was Louise! Sarah gasps.
Louise? Casey stops next to Jamie.
Do what?
I just saw her! He points at the T.V. His friends turn to see. Masked Psychopath stalks a BLOND BOMBSHELL.  20.
She was right there! Casey glares at Jamie.
You couldnвЂ™t have.
I did!
(subtle anger) LouiseвЂ™s dead, Jamie!
No, Goddammit! Sarah staggers up, trying to diffuse the situation.
Jamie, heвЂ™s right. A pale hand grabs JamieвЂ™s shoulder. He screams and whirls around. Louise stands right behind him. Her haunting eyes.
Aw, God!
Jamie.
Babe. Vivien pulls Jamie toward her, hugging him close. Casey looks on, stunned into silence. He watches Louise turn and look at him, marking him with those eyes.
(to Jamie) ItвЂ™s okay. Louise lunges forward. Someone grabs CaseyвЂ™s arm. He jumps and turns. Sarah.  21.
Casey, relax.
Shit. Vivien rubs JamieвЂ™s back. Jamie looks back. No Louise. SheвЂ™s gone.

ItвЂ™s nothing. Casey glides past her, heading toward the hallway.

Jamie, what was it? WhatвЂ™d you see?
I already told you.
They said sheвЂ™s dead.
What? So youвЂ™re saying IвЂ™m crazy?
No, not at all.
SheвЂ™s not dead. I saw her, I swear.
Jamie. I donвЂ™t know. Vivien strokes his worried face.  22.
IвЂ™m sorry. On screen, the woods scene continues. Masked Psychopath closes in on Blonde Bombshell. Their gloved hand raises a long knife.
Bright lighting. Clean. A long mirror. A crammed magazine rack sits by the toilet. Casey rummages through the medicine cabinet, KNOCKING ove various bottles.
Come on. He finds what he was looking for: a small Ziploc bag. whi powder.
Cluttered counters. Sarah navigates through the narrow ha
Casey! She bumps into a counter. A framed photo of the couple on vacation TUMBLES to the floor. Sarah stumbles back, stepping on the glass, CRACKING it. looks down.
Shit. Sarah picks up the remnants and lays them on the counter. She hears a loud SNIFF. She looks at the bathroom door, her eyes full of fire.
You bastard!
The enraged Sarah opens the door. Casey leans over the counter, ready to snort another whit line.  23.
Goddammit, Casey! He stops and stares at her.
Wait.
No, fuck you! He reaches toward her.
Let me explain. Sarah storms out.
Sarah! He charges after her. She SLAMS the door in his face.
Fuck.
A cool BREEZE whips through the towering trees. The uneasy Vivien walks amongst the high grass.
(praying) I beg of you. Vivien looks around, searching for Rob.

I canвЂ™t do this alone, Lord. EXT. LOUISEвЂ™S HOUSE - FRONT YARD - NIGHT Desolate, no neighbors. A clean lawn. Religious ornaments decorate the yard. Vivien emerges from the forest. She sees the log cabin.  24.

Forgive me. Please. INT. LOUISEвЂ™S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - NIGHT Decadent crucifixes hang along the walls. An antique pian rests in the corner. A cozy fireplace. The muted T.V. plays a black-and-white film. Vivien pushes the front door open and staggers inside. He frantic eyes scan the room, but see no one.
Hello? She notices a portrait of Louise hanging over the firepla Like a starlet, Louise poses in the shot, looking so prop and regal.
Please, Lord. Vivien journeys through the rest of the room until she st in something sticky. She looks down. Moist blood.
Look after her in Heaven.

A gorgeous chandelier provides bright lighting. The long dinner table lines up, two chairs seated at each end. Vivien enters, her nervous steps CREAKING on the wooden floor. She sees ROB LEWTON, 44, bearded holy roller, sitting at head of the table, weeping, his face turned away.
Protect her. Vivien approaches him.
Protect my baby girl. He lowers his hand, revealing a blood-stained butcher kni The terrified Vivien stops right next to him.  25.
ThatвЂ™s all, Lord. Vivien reaches toward him.
Protect Louise. Rob snatches her hand.
Oh God! He looks up at her, his eyes full of despair.
YouвЂ™ve gotta believe me! Breaking away, Vivien trips and falls to the floor.

I didnвЂ™t do it! The dazed Vivien turns. She screams in horror. LouiseвЂ™s dead eyes stare right back at her. Blood flows her slit throat, the thick redness sliding down her body, spreading throughout her dress. Rob stands up, shoving his chair back.
I didnвЂ™t kill my baby! Louise leans upright. Blood DRIPS off her fatal wound, SPLASHING to the floor. Vivien crawls back.
No! Rob glances down at the knife. He clutches the wooden handle. Closes his eyes.
Protect me, Lord. Give me strength. Louise reaches toward Vivien. Vivien stumbles to her feet and turns, just avoiding LouiseвЂ™s hand. Rob YELLS and lurches forward, ensnaring Vivien in his ar  26.
No!
The Good Lord will look after me! Rob raises the sharp blade.
HeвЂ™1l1 look after us all!
No, donвЂ™t do this! He THRUSTS the knife into VivienвЂ™s stomach.

Protect us, Lord! She screams as he JAMS the blade into her fragile flesh o and over. INT. CASEYвЂ™S HOUSE - GUEST ROOM - NIGHT Two windows showcase the manicured lawn. Casey and Sarahв portrait hangs over a trophy case. Useless awards from th far-too-distant past. Vivien awakens from her nightmare. Breathing heavy, she checks her surroundings, making sure sheвЂ™s safe. No Rob knife, no Louise. Vivien looks over at the sleeping Jamie Her adrenaline dying down, she notices a collection of framed photos, all of them highlighting CaseyвЂ™s tenure high school baseball star. Some of the pics even show him with a nerdy, benchwarmer Jamie. Vivien cracks a smile.

Morning dew drips from the trees. Crime scene tape surrounds the scene. A couple of police cars sit nearby. Several OFFICERS investigate. PARAMEDICS load ChrisвЂ™s corpse into an ambulance.  27. Standing in the middle of the yard, KANE THORNTON, 55, ja sheriff, glances over at Officer JASON EARLE, 25, smartas newbie. Like an arrogant photographer, Jason takes pictures of th blood-stained grass, having more fun than he should.
(in disbelief) Completely naked. Not missing a beat, Jason leans in for a closer shot.
Yes sir. Naked as a jaybird.
Jesus Christ. Jason faces him.
I got the glass in the car if you wanna see. Kane holds up his hand and steps away, heading for his ca
No thanks, Jason. I think IвЂ™ve had enough.

Suit yourself, Sheriff. Kane opens the door. He looks off toward the dirt road, l in thought. Jason inspects more blood spatter. Like a grisly finger painting, the splashes of redness spread all across the unkempt lawn.
Yes sir. I ainвЂ™t ever heard of no man getting naked before offing himself. He holds the camera steady. Kane remains quiet, an uneasy expression on his face.
Maybe a woman. I wouldnвЂ™t mind no crime scene like that now.  28. Forcing a laugh, Jason takes another shot.

Maybe next time yвЂ™all can call me for one of them bathtub suicides-- An engine CRANKS, interrupting Jason. He turns and watche Kane PULL AWAY. INT. CASEYвЂ™S HOUSE - LIVING ROOM - DAY Afternoon. Sarah, all dressed for the reunion, cleans up coffee table. She CRUSHES a beer can. Wearing a fresh blazer, Casey clutches a longneck and lea against the wall, watching her.
I told you to quit.
Yeah, well, itвЂ™s called stress. Maybe if you worked, youвЂ™d understand. The lackadaisical Casey takes a sip.
The police officer in a hick town. So stressful and important. Sarah slings the can inside the trash bin.
Vivien sits in front of the dresser mirror, putting on her make-up. Straightening his suit, Jamie leans in behind her, trying see his reflection. Vivien glances at him, impressed.
You look good.
You sound so convincing.
No, IвЂ™m serious. Jamie steps away.  29.
Yeah, yeah. Vivien turns around.
Can I ask you something? Jamie stops near the bed, confused.
Yeah. Sure.
What you saw last night. I mean-- Jamie avoids eye contact, a little flustered.
Aw, look, it was nothing, I promise you.
You seemed upset.
Vivien. Vivien stands and approaches him.
I could tell it was bothering you.
ItвЂ™s not a big deal. Vivien stops in front of him.
If it has something to do with your mom, we--
No, fuck no.
I understand- -
It had nothing to do with that. Vivien grabs his arm.  30.
I know how hard itвЂ™s been, Jamie. She was all you had. Jamie breaks away from her grasp.
Not anymore. IвЂ™ve moved on.
Jamie.
Look, just what are you trying to say? You think IвЂ™ve got some kindвЂ™ve fucked-up mommy complex or something.
No! Babe, people react to these things in different ways. ItвЂ™s part of the grieving process.
Awesome. The great Dr. Vivien Dahlgren heals her husband.
IвЂ™m not saying itвЂ™d have to be with me, but thereвЂ™s nothing wrong with talking to somebody, Jamie! Society gives it such a stigma, but itвЂ™s normal. Jamie scoffs. Trying to
I promise it can help if youвЂ™d just give it a chance. Whatever feelings you have, you can be at peace with them. downplay the topic, Jamie caresses VivienвЂ™s face.
Vivien, I love you, and I know youвЂ™re just trying to help, but IвЂ™m not one of your patients. IвЂ™m fine.
Just keep it in mind, will you? Please. For me.  31.
Alright, IвЂ™11 think about it. How about that? Vivien wraps her arms around him.
ThatвЂ™s all IвЂ™m asking. They kiss. Jamie smirks.
Why Dr. Dahlgren anyway? Why not Dr. Tracy? Vivien laughs.
DonвЂ™t tell me youвЂ™re jealous?
Maybe a little. He reaches inside his suit pocket.
YouвЂ™re a real head case.
I prefer "enigmatic."
Fair enough. Jamie retrieves a jewelry box.
Oh. Jamie. He opens the box. A decadent necklace.
Oh my God!
You like it? Vivien kisses him.  32.
Yes, itвЂ™s beautiful! Vivien grabs the box. She holds up the necklace, enamored the beautiful jewelry.
Wow, where did you find this?
Go on, put it on.
Spacious. Generic paintings cover the walls. Casey and Jamie argue near a granddaddy clock. Casey wave the longneck around, spilling booze over his blazer.
(failing at whispering) What the fuck were you thinking back there?
IвЂ™m sorry, I--
We made a promise, remember?
I know, but I wasnвЂ™t lying.
Bullshit. Jamie leans in closer, nose-to-nose with Casey.
I fucking saw her, man! She was in the house. Casey goes quiet. He takes a sip, his eyes wide and restless. Jamie notices his despondency.
Fuck. You saw her too, didnвЂ™t you? Casey looks around, paranoid.  33.
You had to. I-- Casey pushes Jamie back.
It was the dope.
No, it wasnвЂ™t! It was Louise.
That bitch is dead, Jamie!

Casey. Like heвЂ™s wielding a dagger, Casey points the bottle at Jamie.
That bitch ainвЂ™t ever coming back you hear me? Jamie offers a timid nod.

Sarah places CaseyвЂ™s pipe in the table drawer. A KNOCK at the front door distracts her.

Casey!

Come on in.

Casey.  36.
What? So we partied a little, I slept in. So what?

In Whigham? wWhatвЂ™s the fucking emergency? Casey clasps JamieвЂ™s shoulder, feigning a good mood. Ja forces a smirk.

(aggravated) Casey. Vivien walks down the stairs and stops next to Jamie.
You catch a couple of teenagers fucking on Green Creek?

Oh no. Jamie stares at Kane, stunned by the news.

His mama came and IDвЂ™ed him a little while ago.  37.
